posts.content:
An interesting take on a multipurpose Druid, dropping the simple combat prowess of the fighter's class (as in the Oerthblood build) in favor of the extra saves and divine feats that BG brings with the addition of an evil twist. Trap skills are in and taunt's a nice addition. The alignment changes are generally easily achievable being limited to the good-evil axis; one just needs to keep on the edge between LN and LE and step over the border when necessary.

posts.author: HipRedux
posts.content:
This is a strong spellcaster/shapeshifter combination with some great bonuses for the polymorphs (even though I am not a fan of environments that furnish alignment managers).

One change that I feel should have been obvious...

Zen Archery is a temporary attack option that will become valueless by epic levels, if not sooner.  If needs be, and your druid just wants to help pulling apart mobs, the AB increase is not necessary.  Just pick up a ranged weapon and start to pull.  There's no ranged focus as in the Oerthblood variant so attacks will seldom hit and without Druid owning a Cat's Grace buff, it won't get any better soon waiting for AoV to become available at Level 21. But it really doesn't matter that much because spells and/or the shape's attack will be controlling the encounter anyway.

Instead, I recommend the following change:

Level 6 - Replace Zen Archery with Weapon Finesse (need this for Air Elementals).

Level 18 - Replace Weapon Finesse with Improved Critical: Unarmed Strike.  Double the crit range.  Yeah, I know it's just another 5%, but it's still twice the probability of a crit than without it. With the insane APR that's an extra 5% times the monk progression rate, according to Kail's APR stat that means 6 x 5% or 30% better crit chance per round.

After all, this was a build designed to optimize the potential of creature weapons and IC: UAS is one of the few feats that can boost that attack efficiency.  It's just one feat but one that will enhance ALL the druid's creature attacks including (and especially) Dragon Shape.  Last I checked, a dragon sux with a crossbow.
